// Program for the CRNM1301 problem
// Modified string sorting

#include <iostream>
#include <string>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <algorithm>

using namespace std;

int n, t;
string values[105];

// Comparator for sorting
// Check if x + y is > y + x [concatenation]
bool cmp(string x, string y) 
{ 
  string temp1, temp2;

  temp1 = x + y;
  temp2 = y + x;
  if(temp1 > temp2)
   return true;
  return false;
}

int main() 
{
  scanf("%d", &t);
  while(t--) 
  { 
    scanf("%d", &n);
    for(int i = 0; i < n; i++) 
     cin >> values[i];

    sort(values, values + n, cmp);

    // Print the sorted values in decreasing order
    for(int i = 0; i < n; i++)
     cout << values[i];
    printf("\n");
  }

  return 0;
}
